definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)

sentences.english: Cutting edge rolling pin rolls, cuts, and stores all in one.
sentences.chinese: 擀面杖卷刃，割伤，并存储于一身。

sentences.english: Kids will enjoy rolling the fondant on the work mat with the rolling pin.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们将享受滚动达特的工作与垫擀面杖。

sentences.english: A rolling pin was used to smooth out the dough.
sentences.chinese: 擀面杖是用来弄平生面团的。

sentences.english: Italian Sausage elegantly called "Salami", the shape of long thick rounded rolling pin.
sentences.chinese: 意大利肉肠雅称“莎乐美”，形似粗长滚圆的擀面杖。

sentences.english: If the dough sticks to the rolling pin, place it in the freezer for a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 要是面团粘在擀面杖上，放到冰箱里去冻一会儿。

sentences.english: The process is like a package gnocchi dumplings, but do not Rolling pin.
sentences.chinese: 包汤团的过程也像饺子，但不用擀面杖。

definition: piece of dough cut to the right size (for making jiaozi etc)
to let the dough rest (after mixing it)
